newsitem.title: BOTSWANA: BOTSWANAN STOCKS WEEK - MARKET SLIPS IN THIN TRADE.
newsitem.headline: BOTSWANAN STOCKS WEEK - MARKET SLIPS IN THIN TRADE.

text.p: last week as disappointing final results from retailer Metsef
knocked the market and several shares went ex-dividend.
KYS added five thebe to 145 thebe after earlier trades at
140 thebe. Pep also added five thebe to 165.
Losers were Engen down 15 thebe ex-dividend, Metsef down 20
thebe on the 1996 results, Sechaba down 10 thebe and Standard
Untraded were Barclays, Botswana Insurance, Inco, Realestate
Turnover and value was down, with 17,325 (53,395 last week)
shares changing hands for a value of 47,232 pula (154,246). The
index dropped 5.2 points to close at 350.75.
